"List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2011-11-02. Celestine V is a saint of the Catholic Church."Pope St. Celestine V," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-3. ==Early life== Pietro Angelerio was born in the Neopolitan province of Moline. ==Priest== In 1232, Angelerio became a Benedictine monk at age 17; and he was later ordained a priest. ==Pope== In July 1294, the monk was elected pope; and in the same year, he abdicated or resigned from his office.Lizzy Davies. "Pope Benedict XVI resigns," Guardian UK). 11 February 2013; retrieved 2013-2-11. Pope Boniface VIII confined the former pope in the castle of Fumone, and he died there.Society for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge. (1836). "Celestine V," Penny cyclopaedia, Vol. 6, p. 400. ===After his death=== In 1313, Celestine was made a saint by Pope Clement V.Beckett, William. (1836).
